<@UF2TAQ0L8>
I haven’t used mjml but it’s similar to Zurb’s foundation for emails Inky, I think.

The trick I did to make it work was I do all the inlining in the build process before uploading to HubSpot. and  I had to include a {raw} function into the build process because Foundation for emails uses moustache, which uses the same delimiters as HubL

You can do the inlining on HubSpot instead too but I’ve found it to be a little troublesome having HubSpot inline it all sometimes. I think it’s because HubSpot doesn’t by default know what to do with the media queries,since they can’t be inlined. You can work around this by having all of the media queries in a separate <style> and all the stuff you want inlined in the inline <style> element with the data inliner attribute

Also worth noting, if mjml outputs <th> tags in the resulting markup, those will need to be bulk replaced with <td> tags

more info here: <https://growth.org/discuss/html-emails-in-HubSpot-using-zurb-foundation-for-emails>
weird, I’ve never actually had that issue and I use foundation for emails with HubSpot
oh well good to know in-case I run into that problem. I don’t know why these frameworks use TH’s instead of TD’s in the first place
